translation.en: [man 1] What really struck me about The Queen's Gambit
was that it wasn't at all about chess.
It's not about a game. It's about the cost of genius.
[woman 1] It's a story about how you survive in a world
when you have a very specific gift that makes you harder to understand.
translation.ko: 오해를 사기 쉬운 세상에서 살아남는 이야기예요

translation.en: I think she looks to chess as very much an escape.
[man 2] Although it tells that story
about a child genius working up to a world level,
translation.ko: 세계 최정상에 오르는 여정을 보여주는 얘기지만

translation.en: it's actually still more about her demons.
translation.ko: 실제론 그 아이가 겪는 고통을 다뤄요

translation.en: That's right, I can still… Can I still move another piece?
translation.ko: 그럼 여기서 제가 기물 하나 더 옮겨도 돼요?

translation.en: -[man 3] No, it's touch-move. -[all laughing]
Scott sent me the book to read before I met him,
translation.ko: 스콧이 저와 만나기 전에 원작을 보내줬고 "안야 테일러조이 베스 하먼 역"

translation.en: and I devoured the book in about an hour.
I fell in love with Beth immediately, and there was a really strong kinship.
translation.ko: 곧바로 베스에게 푹 빠졌고 강한 연대감을 느꼈어요

translation.en: [man 1] This character is, you know, essentially, her own antagonist,
translation.ko: 이 캐릭터는 본질적으로 자신의 적이기도 하죠

translation.en: and I was fascinated. I'd never read a character like this.
translation.ko: "스콧 프랭크 각본 및 감독" 그런 캐릭터는 처음이어서 매료됐어요

translation.en: Somebody who is so brilliant and so self-destructive,
and in a world that she was already kind of not a part of.
translation.ko: 환영받지 못하는 세상에 발을 들인 거죠

translation.en: -Are you sure you wanna do this? -I'm sure.
We don't have a women's section.
Back in the 1950s, there were very few females turning to chess.
translation.ko: 1950년대에 체스에 몸담는 여성은 흔치 않았어요 "브루스 판돌피니 체스 자문"

translation.en: They weren't given the opportunities.
Beth trying to make her way in a male-dominated discipline and world
translation.ko: 그런 남성 지배적인 세계에서 자기 길을 가는 베스는

translation.en: is something that's quite distinctive and unusual.
Tevis was writing with an understanding of the next century, almost.
translation.ko: "앨런 스콧 공동 제작자" 테비스는 다음 세기를 내다보고 글을 쓴 거예요

translation.en: It's quite brilliant.
How old are you?
Never mind. Don't answer that. It'll just depress me.
translation.ko: 대답하지 마 들으면 자괴감 들 거 같아

translation.en: -Mm. I'm 36. -[chuckles]
She's so centered in how intelligent she is
translation.ko: 베스는 자신의 재능이 뛰어나다는 점에 집중하고

translation.en: that she doesn't necessarily think of herself as a woman first,
translation.ko: 자신이 여성이란 점은 크게 염두에 두지 않는데

translation.en: and I do think that there is something to that,
because you're experiencing the '60s through her
in the way that she just automatically assumes that she is equal.
Am I good enough now?
To tell you the truth of it, child…
you're astounding.
[crew 1] Mark-up.
[Frank] And action!
Almost ten years ago,
Bill Horberg had brought up the book to me as something that I might wanna do.
translation.ko: 빌 호버그가 그 책을 주면서 제가 관심 가질 만한 이야기랬죠

translation.en: We briefly flirted with doing it as a feature,
translation.ko: 영화로 만들면 어떨까 하고 잠시 얘기했고

translation.en: and Allan Scott had written quite a nice script,
and nothing ever came of it.
It was very hard to get a movie like that made at the time.
translation.ko: 당시엔 그런 영화를 찍는 게 무척 어려웠죠

translation.en: Then, right after I finished Godless, I had this revelation,
translation.ko: '그 땅에는 신이 없다'를 마치고 퍼뜩 생각이 나서

translation.en: and I said to him,
"What about The Queen's Gambit as a miniseries?"
The overriding interest I've always had is to make it powerfully emotional.
translation.ko: 제가 늘 무엇보다 중요하게 여기는 건 강렬한 감정을 담아내는 거예요

translation.en: And I think when you extend something,
you get the time to follow all kinds of paths and all kinds of themes.
translation.ko: 수만 가지의 길과 주제를 탐구할 수 있죠

translation.en: What I really wanted to focus on,
and the challenge in turning it into a miniseries, for me,
was making sure that what you're really invested in is her.
translation.ko: 오롯이 베스를 중심으로 이야기를 끌어가는 거였어요

translation.en: Someday, you're gonna be all alone,
so you need to figure out how to take care of yourself.
translation.ko: 그러니 자신을 돌보는 법을 알아야 해

translation.en: [Taylor-Joy] She's come from a home life, and just a lot in life,
translation.ko: 베스는 불우한 가정 환경 등 수많은 우여곡절을 겪고

translation.en: that has left her feeling very unstable.
She doesn't really know where she's going to end up.
translation.ko: 자신의 미래가 어떨지 알 수가 없으니까요

translation.en: What's that game called?
It's called chess.
Will you teach me?
I think Beth's first true connection
translation.ko: 베스가 처음으로 진정한 유대감을 느낀 대상이

translation.en: is with Mr. Shaibel.
It's with somebody who she feels understands
translation.ko: 샤이벌 씨는 자신을 이해해 준다고 느끼죠

translation.en: not only her gift, but how her brain works.
Also, somebody who can tell her "no."
-You have resigned the game. -You didn't tell me that in the rules.
translation.ko: - 넌 방금 기권했어 - 그런 규칙 없었잖아요

translation.en: It's not a rule. It's sportsmanship.
And then I think she's got a wonderful friendship with Jolene,
and that comes from a place of both understanding
that they're very different, and yet, have come from the exact same place.
translation.ko: 정확히 같은 처지라는 걸 알고 있기 때문이죠

translation.en: Most of us are lifers.
Been here a long time.
I would say she's kind of like a mother to Beth,
translation.ko: "모지스 잉그럼 졸린 역" 졸린은 자기 딴에는 자기가 베스 엄마라고 생각하죠

translation.en: in her own little way.
translation.ko: 졸린은 자기 딴에는 자기가 베스 엄마라고 생각하죠

translation.en: They're not adopted for the majority of their lives,
translation.ko: 삶의 많은 시간 동안 입양이 안 됐기에

translation.en: so they kind of do need to depend on each other in that place.
[man 4] Green's to even your disposition.
Orange and brown's for building a strong body. Take 'em both.
translation.ko: 주황과 갈색은 튼튼한 몸을 길러준다, 둘 다 삼켜

translation.en: In the early '60s, late '50s, it was very common to give…
translation.ko: 50년대 말에서 60년대 초에 보육원 아이들에게 안정제를 주는 게 관례였어요

translation.en: children in orphanages tranquilizers
translation.ko: 보육원 아이들에게 안정제를 주는 게 관례였어요

translation.en: to make them easier to handle.
So, yeah, she becomes addicted to tranquilizers
translation.ko: 네, 그래서 베스는 9살에 안정제와 진정제에 중독돼요

translation.en: and sedatives when she's nine.
Well, the trick with addiction, with drinking or drugs or anything,
translation.ko: 중독이란 요소는 그것이 술이든 약이든 간에

translation.en: is making sure that you empathize with the character,
translation.ko: 보는 이로 하여금 그 캐릭터에 공감하게 하면서

translation.en: and still tell a compelling story.
Sleight of hand, for me, was humor sometimes.
translation.ko: 거기에 유머를 섞는 게 까다로운 기술이었어요

translation.en: There's a long sequence where she steals the pills,
translation.ko: 베스가 알약을 훔치는 긴 장면이 나오는데

translation.en: and that was as funny as it is harrowing.
Elizabeth!
As she gets older, she forms many addictions.
She discovers alcohol when she's about 15.
[coughs] It's good.
And consummates that relationship.
Anybody who's dealing with problems of addiction is their own worst enemy.
translation.ko: 중독을 앓는 사람에게는 자기 자신이 최대의 적이죠

translation.en: She keeps self-destructing along the way.
There's a moment when she's been on a particularly tough bender,
translation.ko: 베스가 몇 날 며칠을 술만 마시고 지내던 중에

translation.en: and she meets the first person that she ever played,
who's another girl called Annette Packer.
I-- I knew you were going places, and that meant something to me.
translation.ko: 네가 성공할 줄 알았고 내겐 큰 의미였어

translation.en: That whole exchange was really, really tricky and rough to do,
translation.ko: 그 장면이 무척 까다롭고 연기하기 힘들었어요

translation.en: because I just had to be in this state of "everything is falling apart."
translation.ko: 그때 전 제 모든 게 무너져 내리는 상태인데

translation.en: "And you looked up to me, and now I have to carry that shame."
translation.ko: 절 우러러보는 사람을 만나 그 수치심까지 더해졌으니까요

translation.en: Like, she was just-- She was an angry bird.
I'm worried about you.
What on earth for? [scoffs]
For me, the whole story is organized around that.
Is she gonna lose hold of herself, or is she gonna be able to make it?
"She shows the assurance of a player twice her age."
That's national recognition, dear.
She's also addicted to winning.
She's addicted to feeling like she is in control.
Chess is the one thing she feels like she can control,
that, on that board, she's in charge.
translation.ko: 보드 위에선 자신을 막을 게 없죠

translation.en: Whenever she's moving those pieces around, she's at home.
translation.ko: 기물을 여기저기 옮기는 순간 제일 편안한 거예요

translation.en: I'll win.
I have every confidence.
You do feel for the relationship
that both Mrs. Wheatley and Beth have together.
And Mari played her with deep empathy, and, I think, sympathy.
translation.ko: 마리가 깊은 공감과 연민으로 그 역할을 구현해 냈죠

translation.en: For the role of Mrs. Wheatley, I had been telling Bill Horberg
translation.ko: 휘틀리 부인 역할에 마리엘 헬러 같은 배우면 좋겠다고 빌에게 말했더니

translation.en: that it's someone like Marielle Heller,
translation.ko: 마리엘 헬러 같은 배우면 좋겠다고 빌에게 말했더니

translation.en: and Bill said to me, "Why don't you just cast her?"
translation.ko: 빌이 그냥 마리엘을 섭외하지 그러냐고 했죠

translation.en: And as you can see, she's extraordinary.
Things are beginning to happen.
Beth is very obsessive, full stop.
translation.ko: 베스는 두말할 것 없이 집요한 성격이죠

translation.en: Like, I think that is just something that is intrinsic to her.
translation.ko: 그냥 그 사람 자체가 그런 거 같아요

translation.en: Harry, it'll be check once the pawn moves and the knight trades.
-Can't you see that? -No, I can't.
-I can't find it that fast. -Well, wish you could.
When your brain works that quickly, it can drive you a bit mad.
translation.ko: 머리가 그렇게 빨리 돌면 미쳐버릴 수도 있는데

translation.en: But I also think that she is aware that her gift makes her special.
translation.ko: 베스는 자신의 재능이 특별하단 걸 알고 있는 듯해요

translation.en: [woman 2] Sometimes, people find patterns or meaning where there aren't any.
translation.ko: 실제로는 무관한 현상에서 규칙이나 의미를 찾기도 해

translation.en: What does that have to do with me?
Well, creativity and psychosis often go hand in hand.
I do think she's, like, consistently worried that she's a bit crazy.
translation.ko: 베스는 끊임없이 자신이 미친 건 아닐까 걱정해요

translation.en: Beth has visions of seeing a chess board on the ceiling.
translation.ko: 천장에 뜬 체스판을 환영으로 보기도 하죠 "스티븐 마이즐러 촬영 감독"

translation.en: This is in the book. She looks up to the ceiling
and imagines the position and the places of the pieces.
Did you ever go over games in your head? I mean, play all the way through 'em?
Doesn't everybody?
The person that she feels closest to,
I think, in terms of the way that her brain works, is actually Benny.
translation.ko: 가장 가깝다고 느끼는 사람은 사실 베니라고 생각해요

translation.en: There's a little bit of a reflection in each other,
translation.ko: 둘은 아주 다른 성향이지만 서로의 거울이에요

translation.en: even though they're vastly different.
But I think he enjoys getting into mind games,
translation.ko: 베니는 서슴지 않고 상대의 생각을 파고들어

translation.en: into other people's heads, and he sees that in Beth.
-I don't know if I'm good enough. -You're the best.
translation.ko: - 내 실력도 못 믿겠어 - 넌 단연 최고야

translation.en: His reassurance kind of makes her feel a bit more calm.
translation.ko: 베니의 확신에 찬 격려에 베스가 안정을 얻지만

translation.en: But I do think that she's juggling a very fine line of, like,
"Am I insane or am I a genius?"
And I've been watching your games, you…
You attack like Alekhine.
You can reach for your best,
but it only really matters if other people see it as well.
translation.ko: 남들이 인정할 때 비로소 최고가 되는 거죠

translation.en: And I think Benny appreciates Beth's talent when he sees it
translation.ko: 베니는 베스의 재능을 보자마자 그걸 인정하고

translation.en: and finds that attractive from the get-go.
[Frank] And action!
[Frank] To make chess cinematic is… is impossible.
translation.ko: 체스에 영화적 기교를 넣는 건 불가능해요

translation.en: And I realized I want the chess that we do show to be accurate enough,
translation.ko: 체스 시합을 충분히 정확하게 구현하려는 마음도 있었지만

translation.en: but I really am focusing on the stakes around the games
translation.ko: 제가 더 집중한 부분은 시합을 둘러싼 이해관계와 체스 선수들이죠

translation.en: and the players themselves.
Beth Harmon, in particular, and the idea, for me,
visually, was to get inside her.
I found the strongest points is just being on people's faces and their reaction.
translation.ko: 가장 강렬한 건 그저 사람의 얼굴과 표정이더라고요

translation.en: Even if you don't understand chess, you know the seriousness
translation.ko: 체스를 몰라도 그 표정에서 얼마나 진지한지

translation.en: and the drama that they're going through.
-[chess clock ticking] -I resign.
[crew 2] Cut!
-[crew 3] Cutting! -[crew 4] And one.
Steven Meizler is quite good at shaping just very little light,
translation.ko: 스티븐 마이즐러는 적은 양의 빛과 자연광을 절묘하게 배치하는 데 탁월하고

translation.en: and very natural light,
and-and finding little spots that create its own drama.
translation.ko: 그만의 드라마를 연출하는 작은 요소들을 찾아내요

translation.en: Sweet dreams.
The show really shifts along with Beth's perspective.
translation.ko: 베스의 관점에 따라 이야기가 변화해 가요

translation.en: Every time I got to go onto a new set,
I was always completely blown away by the way that it looked.
translation.ko: 매번 그 모습에 완전히 넋을 잃고 바라봤어요

translation.en: [Frank] Uli Hanisch is a genius.
I came to Berlin because I wanted to work with him.
But we've shot Mexico City here, and Las Vegas,
and Paris, Russia, pieces of New York, and Lexington, Kentucky.
translation.ko: 파리, 러시아, 뉴욕 조금 켄터키주 렉싱턴도 구현했죠

translation.en: Well, now.
What Beth does is traveling, uh, and playing chess at tournaments,
translation.ko: 베스는 전 세계의 체스 토너먼트에 참가해요 "서빈 샤프, 세트 장식 울리 하니슈, 미술 감독" "알렉스 람브리프, 소품"

translation.en: and so we have, like, hotel rooms, airplanes, hotel lobbies, restaurants,
translation.ko: 그래서 호텔 방과 비행기 안 호텔 로비, 레스토랑

translation.en: ballroom kind of situation for each tournament.
translation.ko: 연회장 같은 곳이 토너먼트 때마다 나오죠

translation.en: So, it was our target to, um--
-To repeat, but… [laughs] -To repeat.
-…make it different. -Yeah, exactly.
I asked for a pleasant room, and I believe they gave me one.
translation.ko: 쾌적한 방을 달랬는데 제대로 온 거 같구나

translation.en: This here is a pretty special location in Berlin.
It's the Haus Cumberland, and we turned it into a hotel in Paris.
translation.ko: 하우스 컴벌랜드란 곳이고 여길 파리의 호텔로 꾸몄어요

translation.en: What will you have, then, for your one drink?
Must be special if it is your only one.
-[crew 5] Awesome. -[crew 6] That's a cut.
[Frank] For me, every set I would walk on would be a fantastic place to shoot.
translation.ko: 모든 촬영장이 해당 장면을 찍기에 부족함이 없었어요

translation.en: The whole crew would come on the set,
and you would hear 50 people, 100 people oohing and aahing about these locations.
Benny's apartment was interesting because we shot the exterior in Toronto.
translation.ko: 베니의 아파트는 재밌는 게 외부는 토론토에서 찍었어요

translation.en: [Frank] And then Uli designed this basement apartment that was amazing,
translation.ko: 그러고 나서 울리가 지하 방을 멋지게 꾸며놔서

translation.en: and, right away, I started changing the scene
because of so many good things in the set.
translation.ko: 그 안에서 활용할 게 아주 많았거든요

translation.en: -…what you thought. -[Taylor-Joy] I love it. It's so good.
translation.ko: - 생각한 것과 다르죠 - 좋아요, 맘에 들어요

translation.en: The cinematography, the costumes, the production design,
they're all, for me, part of the same thing.
We spend a lot of time talking about where Beth is at in the story.
translation.ko: 이야기에서 베스가 어디쯤 와 있는지 많이 얘기했죠

translation.en: We had so much fun coming up with the look for this
because, again, we got to grow up with Beth.
When I first read the script, I had in my mind that Beth was a redhead.
translation.ko: 시나리오를 처음 읽고 베스를 빨간 머리로 구상했는데 "대니얼 파커 헤어 & 메이크업"

translation.en: Funny enough, Anya also felt this.
[Taylor-Joy] When I first read it, I was like, "She needs to have red hair,
translation.ko: 책을 읽고 나서 빨간 머리가 좋겠다고 생각했어요

translation.en: because I want her to be completely identifiable,
even if she doesn't want to be,"
and he had thought the exact same thing, so we just started off on a good foot.
translation.ko: 대니얼도 같은 생각이어서 처음부터 죽이 잘 맞았죠

translation.en: It was all wigs. I couldn't-- I was very happy to dye my hair, but I just couldn't…
translation.ko: 다 가발이었어요, 제 머리를 염색하고 싶었지만 못 했죠

translation.en: There were days when we were going between five different ages in a day,
translation.ko: 하루에도 다섯 가지는 되는 연령을 표현해야 하는데

translation.en: and that's just not possible with your own hair.
So, we had baby Beth, we had sexy kitten, and we had glamour-puss.
translation.ko: 어린 베스부터 섹시한 고양이 고혹적인 여우 가발까지 있었어요

translation.en: To sell the age, the younger, the less makeup,
translation.ko: 나이를 표현하기 위해 어릴 땐 화장기를 덜고

translation.en: and then you slowly add very, very small adjustments
until you start seeing her older.
She basically gets more of these eyelashes.
So, her eyes become sexier.
Thanks.
Beth has a thing for flare, as you can see in the show.
translation.ko: 베스는 극에서도 보이듯이 화려한 걸 좋아해요

translation.en: She, um… She likes the finer things in life. She-- She starts to really, really like clothes.
translation.ko: 고급스러운 걸 좋아하고 옷을 엄청 좋아하기 시작하죠

translation.en: With the costume designer, with Gabriele, her wardrobe is just amazing.
translation.ko: 의상 디자이너 가브리엘레의 의상은 정말 굉장해요

translation.en: She would have a pallet book and all of the dresses,
translation.ko: 팔레트 북을 들고 다니며 온갖 드레스와

translation.en: and the different wardrobe that Beth would be wearing.
translation.ko: 베스가 입을 만한 다양한 옷을 준비하는데

translation.en: But more than that, we'd spend a lot of time
translation.ko: 거기서 그치지 않고 많은 시간을 들여

translation.en: talking about where Beth is at in the story.
translation.ko: 베스가 극 중에 어디쯤 와 있는지 얘길 나눴죠

translation.en: In the beginning, Beth is always determined by other people,
translation.ko: 극 초반에는 베스의 모든 것을 남이 결정해요 "가브리엘레 빈더 의상 디자이너"

translation.en: by her mother or dresses in the orphanage,
translation.ko: 옷도 엄마나 보육원에서 주는 대로 입죠

translation.en: and later on, she is alone, and she discovers more her body.
translation.ko: 나중에는 혼자가 되고 자기 몸을 좀 더 인식하면서

translation.en: She has power being feminine.
[Frank] As we go forward, you know, she's more and more glamorous.
translation.ko: 극이 진행되면서 베스는 더욱 매력적으로 변해 가죠

translation.en: There's a point where she dresses up like a pop musician
that she sees on TV for a brief period of time.
translation.ko: 팝 뮤지션을 따라 옷을 차려입기도 해요

translation.en: She experienced that searching for cool is difficult
translation.ko: 베스는 멋을 찾아 헤매지만 그 멋이 존재하지 않아 어렵다는 걸 알게 돼요

translation.en: because the cool doesn't exist,
translation.ko: 그 멋이 존재하지 않아 어렵다는 걸 알게 돼요

translation.en: and her search for cool is, actually, her search for herself.
translation.ko: 사실 멋을 찾아 헤매는 건 자신을 찾아 헤매는 것과 같아요

translation.en: [Frank] At the very end,
when she's kind of finally comfortable in the world of chess,
translation.ko: 베스가 드디어 체스 세계에서 안정감을 느끼는데

translation.en: Gabriele found this beautiful, long, white coat,
translation.ko: 가브리엘레가 정말 예쁜 긴 하얀 코트에

translation.en: with this white hat from Moscow,
and you realize she looks like the white queen.
[Taylor-Joy] What's fascinating about watching her grow up is…
she puts on all of these different personas.
Who the hell are you?
It is incredibly sad, because it's basically just saying
translation.ko: 정말 가엾은 점이죠 그런 가면을 쓰지 않고는

translation.en: that she just doesn't feel like she's enough without them.
You are very beautiful.
-I don't see myself that way. -Then you are blind.
translation.ko: - 내 눈엔 그렇게 안 보여 - 그럼 눈이 먼 거지

translation.en: It's not a physical loneliness that she's suffering from.
It's an emotional and intellectual one.
I think this is why the miniseries is becoming more prominent,
translation.ko: 미니 시리즈가 더욱더 각광 받는 이유는

translation.en: because you can explore these richer, more complex stories.
translation.ko: 이야기의 다양한 면을 더 풍부하게 담을 수 있어서죠

translation.en: Having the opportunity to spend time with Beth in this way,
translation.ko: 베스와 함께하는 접근 방식이 좋았던 거 같아요

translation.en: and not just see all of the wins, but all of the hard work
translation.ko: 우승하는 모습만이 아닌 우승을 위해 고군분투하고 희생하는 모습을 보여줘서요

translation.en: with the sacrifices that it takes to get to the wins.
translation.ko: 우승을 위해 고군분투하고 희생하는 모습을 보여줘서요

translation.en: I think, hopefully, that just builds a lot of empathy for somebody who…
translation.ko: 그런 점이 제가 마음을 다해 아끼는 누군가에게

translation.en: I, selfishly, really, really care about.
